channel.title: R on A minimal Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in R on A minimal Hugo website

item.title: Shortcuts in R studio
item.description: R shortcuts make the programming life easier. They are available directly in the Navigation Bar - Tools- Keyboard shortcuts help. I listed commonly used shortcuts that might help R beginners (students) like me: Table1: shortcuts make life easier Windows & Linux Mac Open Document Ctrl + O Cmd + O New R Script Ctrl + Shift + N Cmd + Shift + N Run Selected Line Ctrl + Shift + ↵ Cmd + Shift + ↵ Undo Ctrl + Z Cmd + Z Redo Ctrl + Shift + Z Cmd + Shift + Z Copy Ctrl + C Cmd + C Paste Ctrl + Y Cmd + Y Cut Ctrl + X Cmd + X Move Lines Up/Down Alt+Up/Down Option+Up/Down Run Selected Line Ctrl + Shift + ↵ Cmd + Shift + ↵ Delete Line Ctrl + D Cmd + D Move to Line start Ctrl + Left Cmd + Left Move to Line end Ctrl + Right Cmd + Right Select to Line Start Ctrl + Shift + Left Cmd + + Shift + Left Select to Line End Ctrl + Shift + Right Cmd + + Shift + Right Insert Pipe Operator( %>% ) Ctrl + Shift + M Cmd + Shift + M Find Ctrl + F Cmd + F

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
